manager

Class PowerManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • manager.PowerGayManager

  • public class PowerManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages all the power failures in the game. This includes randomly activating primary power failures. Making sure that secondary and tertiary power failures rotate. 1) DecreaseTurn: Only primary failures will throw exceptions here. If an exception is catched, we know the power failure is at end of life. We remove itself and its children. 2) DecreaseAction: Only secondary and tertiary powerfailures are afflicted by decrease in actions. If an exception is catched, the distinction can be made if the power has a child. Secondaries will rotate in a direction, and the tertiaries will move with them.
    Author:
    vincent

    • Method Detail

      • getGrid

        public Grid getGrid()
        Returns the grid.

      • powerFailSquares

        public void powerFailSquares()
        Sets the state of any square to a PowerFailure state with a 1% chance.

      • powerFailSquare

        protected void powerFailSquare(Square square)
        We power fail one square and set two squares near it as a secondary and tertiary power fail.
        Parameters:
        square - the square to be powerfailed.

      • clearPowerFailures

        public void clearPowerFailures()
        Clears all powerFailures, for testing purposes.

      • getSquare

        protected Square getSquare(Power power)
        Gets the square associated with the power.
        Parameters:
        power - the power of which the square is wanted.
        Returns:
        Square If the power can be found on a square. Null If there is no square with the power.

      • decreaseTurn

        public void decreaseTurn()
        Updates the power failures with the end of a turn. If an exception is catched, it is because a primary power failure has ended. Thus itself and its children will be removed from the grid.

      • decreaseAction

        public void decreaseAction()
        Decreases the action of a power failure. Actions only affect on secondary and tertiary. Primary will only throw exceptions on a decrease in turn. We can make the distinction based on wether the power has a child or not.
